subject: RE: [junit] Book Recommendations and Where to put tests?
msgSnippet: I ll second J.B. s book recommendations, including his own!  I bought the ebook edition some days ago, and I ve already begun to apply what I ve learned.  My
messageBody:
I'll second J.B.'s book recommendations, including his own! I bought the
ebook edition some days ago, and I've already begun to apply what I've
learned. My unit tests (Programmer Tests) are simpler and clearer.

The material on organizing tests presents multiple points of view, offers
the authors' own preferences and their reasons for having them based on
those points of view. It's very practical. Of course, J.B. is very
practical, evidenced by his replies in this group and having met him once at
XP/AU 2002 in Chicago.

Nice work J.B. and Scott!

Craig Demyanovich
